column1: 1 ^ Exsultáte, justi, in Dòmino~
column2: rêctos dècet collaŭdátio. ^ Rejoice, O ye just, in the Lord~

column1: 2 ^ Confitémini Dòmino in cìttara~
column2: in psaltério dècem chordárum psállite illi. ^ Give praise to the Lord on the harp~
column3: sing to him with the psaltery, the instrument of ten strings.

column1: 3 ^ Cantáte ei cánticum novum~
column2: bène psállite ei in vociferatióne. ^ Sing to him a new canticle, sing well unto him with a loud noise.

column1: 4 ^ Qŭia rêctum èst vèrbum Dòmini, et òmnia ópera ejus in fide. ^ For the word of the Lord is right, and all his works are done with faithfulness.
5 ^ Díligit misericórdiam et judìcium~
column2: misericórdia Dòmini plena èst terra. ^ He loveth mercy and judgment~
column3: the earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.

column1: 6 ^ Vèrbo Dòmini caĕli firmáti sunt, et spíritu oris ejus òmnis virtûs eórum~
column2: ^ By the word of the Lord the heavens were established, and all the power of them by the spirit of his mouth~

column1: 7 ^ còngregans sicut in utre aqŭas maris~
column2: ponens in tesáŭrîs abìssos. ^ gathering together the waters of the sea as in a vessel
column3: laying up the depths in storehouses.

column1: 8 ^ Tìmeat Dòminum òmnis terra~
column2: ab eo aŭtem commoveántur òmnes inhabitántes orbem. ^ Let all the earth fear the Lord~
column3: let then all the inhabitants of the world be in awe of him.

column1: 9 ^ Qŭóniam ìpse dixit, et facta sunt~
column2: ìpse mandávit, et creáta sunt. ^ For he spoke and they were made~
column3: he commanded, and they were created.

column1: 10 ^ Dòminus dìssipat consìlia gèntium~
column2: réprobat aŭtem cogitatiónes populórum, et réprobat consìlia princìpium. ^ The Lord bringeth to nought the counsels of nations~
column3: moreover he rejecteth the devices of people, and casteth away the counsels of princes.

column1: 11 ^ Consìlium aŭtem Dòmini in aĕtèrnum manet~
column2: cogitatiónes cordis ejus in generatióne et generatiónem. ^ But the counsel of the Lord standeth for ever~
column3: the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

column1: 12 ^ Beáta gens cujus èst Dòminus Deus ejus~
column2: pòpulus qŭem elégit in hereditátem sìbi. ^ Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord~
column3: the people whom he hath chosen for his inheritance.

column1: 13 ^ De caĕlo respèxit Dòminus~
column2: vîdit òmnes fílios hòminum. ^ The Lord hath looked from heaven~
column3: he hath beheld all the sons of men.

column1: 14 ^ De praĕparáto habitáculo suo respèxit super òmnes qŭi hábitant terram. ^ From his habitation which he hath prepared he hath looked upon all that dwell on the earth.
15 ^ Qŭi fìnxit sigillátim corda eórum~
column2: qŭi intèllegit òmnia ópera eórum. ^ He who hath made the hearts of every one of them~

column1: 16 ^ Non salvátur rex per multam virtútem, et gigas non salvábitur in multitúdine virtútis suaĕ. ^ The king is not saved by a great army, nor shall the giant be saved by his own great strength.
17 ^ Fallax èqŭus ad salútem~
column2: in abundántia aŭtem virtútis suaĕ non salvábitur. ^ Vain is the horse for safety~
column3: neither shall he be saved by the abundance of his strength.

column1: 18 ^ Ecce òculi Dòmini super metuèntes eum, et in eîs qŭi sperant super misericórdia ejus, ^ Behold the eyes of the Lord are on them that fear him, and on them that hope in his mercy,
19 ^ ut éruat a morte ánimas eórum, et alat eos in fame. ^ that he should deliver their souls from death, and feed them in famine.
20 ^ Ánima nostra sùstinet Dòminum, qŭóniam adjútor et protéctor noster èst. ^ Our soul waiteth for the Lord, for he is our helper and protector.
21 ^ Qŭia in eo laĕtábitur cor nostrum, et in nómine sancto ejus sperávimus. ^ For in him our heart shall rejoice, and in his holy name we have trusted.
22 ^ Fiat misericórdia tua, Dòmine, super nos, quemádmodum sperávimus in te. ^ Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we have hoped in thee.
